Experiment_description: The experiments involve processing sequences using a Bi-GRU encoder with a SimCLR-style self-supervised learning approach. The models were fine-tuned using cross-entropy loss and evaluated using metrics like Shape-Weighted Accuracy and Color-Weighted Accuracy.
Significance: These experiments are significant as they demonstrate the efficacy of Bi-GRU encoders combined with contrastive learning for sequence representation tasks, achieving high accuracy and generalization. Insights from these experiments can guide further optimization in self-supervised learning methods.
Description: The experiments utilized the SPR_BENCH dataset, building a token-level vocabulary and encoding sequences with a Bi-GRU encoder. Models were pre-trained using augmented views and a SimCLR-style NT-Xent loss, followed by fine-tuning with a linear classifier. Metrics were stored and analyzed, with plots generated for visual insights.

List_of_included_plots.description: This plot shows the fine-tuning loss for both training and validation datasets over two epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The decreasing loss values suggest successful training and good generalization, as the validation loss is consistently lower than the training loss.

List_of_included_plots.description: The plot shows the fine-tuning loss for both training and validation sets over three epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: Rapid decrease in training loss and convergence with validation loss indicate effective learning and generalization.

List_of_included_plots.description: The plot shows the fine-tuning loss for both training and validation datasets over two epochs.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The consistent decrease in loss values indicates effective learning and potential for further optimization.
